definition.procedurexml: <xml xmlns="https://developers.google.com/blockly/xml"><variables><variable type="Number" id="tikal_hints">tikal_hints</variable></variables><block type="event_trigger" deletable="false" x="210" y="-131"><field name="trigger">no_ext_trigger</field><next><block type="variables_set_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field><value name="VAL"><block type="math_java_constants"><field name="CONSTANT">RANDOM</field></block></value><next><block type="controls_if"><mutation elseif="18" else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> The background music of Sonic's world can be disabled using the ambience controls in the Sound settings. </field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF1"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">2</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO1"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> You can get Special Stage Keys by defeating bosses or, on a rare occasion, finding one in a Chemical Plant Zone treasure chest.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF2"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">3</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO2"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> Chaos really is a loving and gentle creature. Please don't do anything to make him mad!</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF3"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">4</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO3"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> Destroying those harmful machines (badniks) will release the little creatures inside them.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF4"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">5</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO4"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> If you come across an animal capsule but don't have a pickaxe, you can just jump on the yellow button on top to set the creatures free.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF5"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">6</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO5"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> Right-click Tails with an empty hand to make him fly. While he's flying, right-click him again and he'll lift you into the air!</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF6"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">7</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO6"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> I am a 3,000-year-old spirit who hates violence, so please excuse me if I shrink a little when I'm near danger.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF7"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">8</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO7"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> Whatever you do, please don't hurt the little animals roaming around Sonic's world! They're harmless!</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF8"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">9</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO8"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> The servers are the seven Chaos. Chaos is power... Power enriched by the heart. The controller is the one that unifies the chaos.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF9"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">10</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO9"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> Rings are a form of defense, and should not be used for greed.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF10"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">11</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO10"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> You can still lose a shield in Creative Mode if you touch something that would normally hurt you in Survival Mode.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF11"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">12</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO11"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> Chemical Plant Zone has giant syringes that you need to use in order to access some treasure.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF12"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">13</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO12"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> The main attractions of Marble Zone are its dangerous dungeons, which lie underneath the ground.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF13"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">14</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO13"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> I only have so much advice to give, so I may end up repeating myself every now and then.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF14"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">15</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO14"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> Chaostone, pronounced "chow-stone", is what we call the underground material of Sonic's world.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF15"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">16</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO15"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> Starposts were originally intended to set your spawnpoint when walked into, but I guess EnderPreston couldn't figure out how to do it yet, so they're only a decoration for now.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF16"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">17</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO16"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> I know that "Black Market" means something else where you come from, but in Sonic's world, the Black Market is actually a good place to get special items like Chao Fruit, Earth minerals, and other fascinating stuff.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF17"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">18</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO17"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> Chao are friendly creatures that hatch from eggs found in Chao Gardens. You can feed them, name them, and pet them!</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><value name="IF18"><block type="math_binary_ops"><field name="OP">LT</field><value name="A"><block type="variables_get_number"><field name="VAR">local:tikal_hints</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_dual_ops"><field name="OP">MULTIPLY</field><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">0.05</field></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><field name="NUM">19</field></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO18"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> If you ever get worried about my safety, or just want me to go away, let me know with a friendly tap. I'll fly away and leave behind a Totem of Guidance, which you can use to summon me again.</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement><statement name="ELSE"><block type="entity_send_chat"><value name="text"><block type="text"><field name="TEXT"><Tikal> Fake Chaos Emeralds have the same wavelength and properties as a real Chaos Emerald, but if you hit a robot with it, the robot will explode! That being said, please make sure no harmless creatures get hurt in the process!</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="source_entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field name="BOOL">FALSE</field></block></value></block></statement></block></next></block></next></block></xml>
